intro: Gonosuke scaber, commonly known as the rough-stemmed gonosuke, is a unique plant species characterized by its rough, textured stems and distinctive leaf morphology. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate regions with well-drained soil. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its rough texture. Gonosuke scaber produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white, adding to its ornamental value in botanical gardens.
